intro: Cydista aequinoctialis var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy cydista, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
